title: Where the Crawdads Sing

description: A coming-of-age murder mystery set in the marshlands of North Carolina, blending evocative nature writing and suspense.

title: The Handmaid’s Tale

description: Dystopian classic about women reduced to childbearing roles in an authoritarian theocracy, exploring power and resistance.

title: The Kite Runner

description: A powerful story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption set in Afghanistan before and after Soviet occupation.

title: The Nightingale

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description: A reclusive Hollywood icon recounts her rise to fame and tangled personal life in a compulsively readable confessional.

title: Gone Girl

description: A brilliantly twisted psychological thriller of a marriage’s unraveling told via two unreliable perspectives.

description: Journalist Mikael Blomkvist and hacker Lisbeth Salander uncover decades of family secrets.

title: And Then There Were None

description: Ten strangers on an island are murdered one by one in the ultimate classic of suspense.

title: The Girl on the Train

description: An unreliable narrator witnesses something shocking from a commuter train and becomes entangled in a missing‑person case.

title: I Have Some Questions for You

title: The Housemaid

description: A newly hired housemaid uncovers dangerous secrets inside a wealthy family’s home.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: A dystopian survival tale where Katniss Everdeen becomes a symbol of rebellion in a televised fight to the death.

author: George Orwell
description: Iconic dystopian novel depicting a totalitarian regime surveilling and controlling thought.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: Epic space opera about politics, religion, and ecology on a desert planet—immensely influential in SF.

title: Foundation

description: A sweeping saga of civilization's rise and fall, pioneering the genre of psychohistory.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut stranded on Mars uses engineering wit to survive—blending hard science and humor.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
description: A lone astronaut must save Earth from extinction, forging unlikely alliances in deep space.

title: Network Effect
author: Martha Wells
description: Full‑length Murderbot novel: an AI security unit wrestles with autonomy, loyalty, and unexpected friendships.

title: The Three-Body Problem
author: Liu Cixin
description: Alien contact and cosmic consequences told through Chinese science fiction—brought global acclaim.

title: Ready Player One
author: Ernest Cline
description: A virtual‑reality treasure hunt steeped in 1980s pop culture; engaging adventure with nostalgic appeal.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: Dystopian masterpiece exploring women’s oppression in a theocratic state—resurgent after TV adaptation.

description: The first in A Song of Ice and Fire, a gritty epic fantasy with political intrigue and moral complexity.

title: The Hobbit

author: E. L. James

title: Outlander
author: Diana Gabaldon
